Package tools

Class ArgumentsParser

java.lang.Object
tools.ArgumentsParser
public final class ArgumentsParser
extends java.lang.Object
Parser for command line arguments.

Used to parse, validate and access all passed command line options or print help information to the user.

TODO: The following options are currently deprecated in version 2.0: options.addOption("u", "uncovered", false, "write uncovered positions for each sample"); options.addOption("lc", "lowCov", false, "calculate low coverage regions"); options.addOption("ca", "covAdd", true, "minCoverage to make additional call ["+this.minCovAdd+"]"); options.addOption("d", "compare", true, "calculate differences compared to other SNVTable"); options.addOption("s", "sharedAlleleFreq", false, "write shared allele frequencies for each position"); options.addOption("ogf", "outgroupFile", true, "vcfFile for outgroup"); options.addOption("ogn", "outgroupName", true, "name for outgroup (contained in input)");

Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean addReference
    Whether the reference genome sequence should be added to the alignment.

    Whether config files for the interactive visualization extension should be generated.

    ArrayList of GeneFeature objects representing gene names, their parent sequence and locations, that are exclusively analysed instead of the whole genome.

    • sampleNames

      private final java.util.List<java.lang.String> sampleNames
      ArrayList of String objects representing the names for each sample. The i-th entry corresponds to the name of the i-th .vcf file represented in the `sampleInput` property.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArgumentsParser

      public ArgumentsParser​(java.lang.String[] args) throws MusialCLAException, org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException, MusialFaultyDataException, MusialDuplicationException
      Constructor of the ArgumentParser class.

      The ArgumentParser is used to parse and validate the user command line input for Musial. Parsed arguments are stored - and accessible - via class properties.

      Parameters:
      args - String Array containing the command line arguments.
      Throws:
      MusialCLAException - If any error occurs during parsing or validating an MusialCLAException is thrown.
      org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException
      MusialFaultyDataException
      MusialDuplicationException
